title: State Department restarts some Central America assistance
text:
The State Department will resume “targeted” foreign assistance for Guatemala, El Salvador and Honduras, according to an announcement Wednesday.

The move comes after President Donald Trump in March ordered a freeze on hundreds of millions in development and security funding for the Central American nations. At the time, Trump said the countries hadn’t slowed adequately the outflow of migrants toward the U.S.

Story Continued Below

“Thanks to the president’s policy and to the response from these countries, we are seeing great progress,” Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said in a written statement Wednesday. “To enable further progress in these countries’ efforts, some targeted Department of State and USAID funding will resume at this time.”
